docs.lead_paragraph: The new year may not bring an end to unemployment woes, but many workers who get laid off in 2010 will receive a helping hand with paying for health insurance, if a little-noticed proposal in President Obama's budget for the fiscal year 2011 is adopted.
docs.abstract: The president's proposed budget would extend health insurance subsidies for laid-off workers.
docs.snippet: The president's proposed budget would extend health insurance subsidies for laid-off workers.

docs.lead_paragraph: When Dr. Andrew Wakefield - the British doctor who linked vaccines to autism - was found to be "dishonest," "irresponsible" and acting "contrary to the clinical interests" of a child by a medical-misconduct panel last week, and when the respected medical journal The Lancet officially retracted its publication of Wakefield's 1998 study earlier today, those were but the most recent controversial moments in the medical mystery that is autism.
docs.abstract: Liane Carter describes her frustration with those who prey on the desperation of parents with unfounded promises of an answer.
docs.snippet: Liane Carter describes her frustration with those who prey on the desperation of parents with unfounded promises of an answer.

docs.lead_paragraph: Accusations of Bullying | Steve Poizner, the state's insurance commissioner and a candidate for the Republican gubernatorial nomination, accused his rival in the primary, Meg Whitman, of criminally trying to bully him out of the race. In a complaint with federal and state authorities, Mr. Poizner said that Mike Murphy, an official in the Whitman campaign, sent him an e-mail message urging him to leave the race and run for the Senate in 2012. Mr. Murphy, in a statement, did not deny claim. "After reading the ridiculous charges made by Steve Poizner during today's strange press conference," Mr. Murphy's statement said, "all I can say is that I'm starting to worry about the commissioner's mental condition." [The New York Times]

docs.lead_paragraph: Without her family’s knowledge, doctors used cancer cells from Henrietta Lacks to develop vaccines and life-saving drugs, a case examined in a book that looks at the issue of “tissue rights.”

docs.lead_paragraph: It has been more than six months since President Obama held a prime-time news conference at the White House. A new study finds that places him on a par with Herbert Hoover for the number of times he has held formal news conferences with reporters. The White House says this statistic does not reflect today's reality of how Americans receive their news and information. So in the search for creative ways to convey the president's message, the White House turned to YouTube, where more than 11,000 questions had been submitted since last week's State of the Union speech.

headline.kicker: TAKING THE MEASURE OF POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama, in a question-and-answer session posted on YouTube, the online video-sharing site, said that "it is my greatest hope" that health care legislation be adopted "not just a year from now, but soon." Yet he also referred to the effort in the past tense: "We came extremely close," he said - a sign that the fate of the health care measure is now highly uncertain.

headline.main: Obama Calls Health Overhaul 'My Greatest Hope'
